subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing endless loops
msgSnippet: ... You won t want to write a test that says, Method X should halt after n seconds, because you could write that about every method. If you re doing
messageBody:
>So said Mark Derricutt on 2003-07-07 --------------------
>I just came accross some code today that was getting trapped into an
>endless loop under certain circumstances, it was a simple bug which is
>fixed without any tests ( naughty me ), but afterwards I was thinking
>about
>how I would test it, but my brains come to a standing point...
>
>Any simple way of testing these sorts of things? I thought of running the
>code in a new thread, and having the test wait for x seconds and if its
>not
>finnished, kill the thread and fail the test, but I'm not sure...

You won't want to write a test that says, "Method X should halt after n seconds," because you could write that about every method. If you're doing performance testing, then that's different; but if you're just doing behavioral testing, then I wouldn't do that.

If a test never halts, interpret that as a failure. Been there. It's something outside the system that requires human intervention. The cost of replacing that with self-verification is prohibitive.

Hmmm. I would probably add a TimedTest (JUnitPerf) for that case, just to protect against regression.
